benak.tomas.crimemonitor.library

Class CrimesSummaryBasic

  • java.lang.Object
    • benak.tomas.crimemonitor.library.CrimeSummaryWithUtvarBase
      • benak.tomas.crimemonitor.library.CrimeSummaryWithUtvarAndIntervalBase
        • benak.tomas.crimemonitor.library.CrimesSummaryBasic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UtvarAndIntervalBasedCrimeSummary, UtvarBasedCrimeSummary, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CrimesSummary, CrimeSummaryDetailed

    public class CrimesSummaryBasic
extends CrimeSummaryWithUtvarAndIntervalBase
implements java.io.Serializable
    A base class used to hold some basic crime statistics related to a particular department and crime data interval.

    The included base crime statistics are:

    • the crime index
    • the crime solved ratio
    • the crime trend

    Whenever we talk about the crimes or committed crimes, we mean the crimes that are associated with the given police department and the given crime data interval.

    Crime index

    Crime index is a number from [0,1]. To calculate it we need to get the the crimes per citizen number.
    There is p citizens living in the territory of the given police department.
    There is c number of committed crimes.
    Then c_p is "crimes per capita" for the given department and the crime data interval and is calculated using c_p = (c / p).

    The crimes per capita is calculated for every police department and the given crime data interval. The maximum value is c_p_max.

    Now the crime index value ci is calculated by norming the c_p by c_p_max as ci = (c_p / c_p_max).

    Crime solved ratio

    This is the ratio between the number of the solved crimes and the total number of committed crimes.

    Crime trend

    Crime trend is a measure used to describe the fact, whether the crime counts observed during the months of the crime data interval tend to go up, are stable, or tend to go down.
    The value of this measure is intended to give a hint about what the crime count might be (mainly) in future.

    The calculation method

    Crime trend is calculated for the series of observations related to a particular month, also called the crime count monthly histogram.
    See CrimeMonthHistogramObservation for the definition of the term.

    Simple linear regression is used to approximate the histogram graph and the resulting crime trend value is determined by the slope of the approximating line. For some e > 0 and the slope s we determine the trend value as follows:

    • s > e: CrimeMeasureTrend.Up
    • -e <= s and s <= e : CrimeMeasureTrend.Stable
    • s < -e: CrimeMeasureTrend.Down
    Author:
    Tom
    See Also:
    CrimeMeasureTrend, CrimeMonthHistogramObservation, a class providing a crime count monthly histogram, Serialized Form

        Parameters:
        crimeIndex - the crime index value
        objasnenost - the crime solved ratio value
        trend - the crime trend value
        kodUtvaruSpachaniNeboZjisteni - the police department code associated with the statistics

        startMonth - the initial month of the crime data interval associated with the statistics
        endYear - the terminal year of the crime data interval associated with the statistics
        endtMonth - the terminal month of the crime data interval associated with the statistics
